snippet: Officials from the United States and Russia have urged localized cease-fires to jump-start peace talks, but some rebels have regretted making deals with the state.
abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry and Russian Foreign Min Sergey V Lavrov are working for localized cease-fires in Syria to jump-start peace talks, but rebels and some civilians say deals are deceptive and more like surrender; Pres Bashar al-Assad is said to attack rebel areas that refuse to accept the offers.

byline.contributor: Mohammad Ghannam and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Officials from the United States and Russia have urged localized cease-fires to jump-start peace talks, but some rebels have regretted making deals with the state.

headline.main: Syrian Rebels Say Cease-Fire Deals Prove Deceptive
headline.print_headline: Syria Rebels Say Cease-Fire Deals Prove Deceptive

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
